data.Sentence: --- Lesson 41  Do you call that a hat?

data.Sentence_cn: “你把那个叫帽子吗？”我对妻子说。
data.Sentence: 'Do you call that a hat?' I said to my wife.

data.Sentence_cn: “你说话没必要这样不客气，”我的妻子边回答边照着镜子。
data.Sentence: 'You needn't be so rude about it,' my wife answered as she looked at herself in the mirror.

data.Sentence_cn: 我坐在一个新式的满是网眼儿的椅子上，等待着。
data.Sentence: I sat down on one of those modern chairs with holes in it and waited.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们在这家帽店已经呆了半个小时了，而我的妻子仍在镜子面前。
data.Sentence: We had been in the hat shop for half an hour and my wife was still in front of the mirror.

data.Sentence_cn: “我们不应该买我们不需要的东西，”我突然发表意见说，但马上又后悔说了这话。
data.Sentence: 'We mustn't buy things we don't need,' I remarked suddenly. I regretted saying it almost at once.

data.Sentence_cn: “你没必要这么说，”我妻子回答说，
data.Sentence: 'You needn't have said that,' my wife answered.

data.Sentence_cn: “我也不必提醒你昨天买的那条糟糕透了的领带。”
data.Sentence: 'I needn't remind you of that terrible tie you bought yesterday.'

data.Sentence_cn: “我觉得它好看，”我说，“男人有多少领带也不会嫌多。”
data.Sentence: 'I find it beautiful,' I said. 'A man can never have too many ties.'

data.Sentence_cn: “女人有多少帽子也不嫌多。”她回答。
data.Sentence: 'And a woman can't have too many hats,' she answered.

data.Sentence_cn: 10分钟以后，我们一道走出了商店。
data.Sentence: Ten minutes later we walked out of the shop together.

data.Sentence_cn: 我妻子戴着一顶像灯塔一样的帽子。
data.Sentence: My wife was wearing a hat that looked like a lighthouse!

title.title: Do you call that a hat?
